wikipedia_page.main: James "Jim" Gerald Drake (20 February 1931 – 8 October 2008) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative for Great Britain, English League XIII and Cumberland, and at club level for Heworth ARLFC, Hull FC and Hull Kingston Rovers, as a fullback, prop, second-row, or loose forward, i.e. number 1, 8 or 10, 11 or 12, or 13, during the era of contested scrums.

* Jim Drake (rugby league) (1931–2008), English rugby league footballer of the 1950s and 1960s

response: Bill Drake was born in Workington, Cumberland, and was the younger (by 10-minutes) twin brother of fellow rugby league footballer; Jim Drake, exactly four years to the day after the death of his twin brother Jim Drake, Bill Drake died aged 81 in York Hospital, North Yorkshire, England.
